feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Analytics Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP Analytics Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud – Import Job fails before column mapping (invalid table name / merge error)
entry.content:
Hello,

I am facing an issue when creating a data import job in SAP Analytics Cloud, where the process fails before the column mapping screen is displayed, while using the Classic Data Model. This issue started occurring after a system update that was applied yesterday.

Has anyone experienced a similar issue after the recent update, or knows what might have changed that could cause this behavior?

Any insights or guidance would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you.

entry.title: Transport SAC Objects(Folders, Model, Dimensions, Data Action) and Create Folder Using REST APIs
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I am able to copy a story from one folder to another in SAP Analytics Cloud using REST APIs.

Now I want to do the same programmatically for other objects:

  • Folder
  • Model
  • Dimensions
  • Connections
  • Data Actions

Additionally, I want to create a folder under Public > MyFiles using REST APIs (or any other supported programmatic way).

My questions:

  1. Which REST APIs are supported to transport these objects to another folder?
  2. If REST APIs are not supported for some objects, what is the recommended alternate approach?
  3. Is there any API available to create folders programmatically in SAC?

Thanks

entry.title: SAC Restricted measure behavior
entry.content:
Hello Gurus,

Trying to add a restricted measure to show the total budget for each project as attached in below screenshot. The issue is that I have total budget for some project coming from actual version, and some other projects from plan version.

In the table I only need show the plan version,since some other measures are used like depreciation and capitalization.

With this setup, I am not able to see data for the total budget calculated account. Any thoughts ?

 

 

Thanks.

entry.title: After switching to DigiCert TLS RSA4096 Root G5, an error occurred with the SAC API token value.
entry.content:
I am calling the SAC API in Java to synchronize users and authorizations. After replacing the certificate with DigiCert TLS RSA4096 Root G5, the following error occurs. The JDK version installed on the server is OpenJDK 1.8.0_281, and even after upgrading to Oracle JDK 8u401, the same error persists. I am not sure how to resolve this issue.

 

Error Message..

sun.security.validator.ValidatorException: PKIX path building failed: sun.security.provider.certpath.SunCertPathBuilderException: unable to find valid certification path to requested target

entry.title: Can't change Member Order in Tables (New Table Build Experience) / BW-Live
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

we use SAC with a BW Live connection.
In the new table widget, I can no longer find a way to arrange columns in the desired order.

In the example, I would actually like to display the columns in the order PY; AC; BD and not AC; PY; BD:

In the SAP Help Portal, I found a note that it is not possible to sort columns yourself when using a hierarchy with a BW Live connection. Is this really the case, or how is sorting affected now?

In the old widget, this was possible without any problems.

Old Widget:

New Widget:

Best regards

Thorsten

entry.title: SAC Story – File Versioning shows only “Current Version” although the story was saved multiple times
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am currently testing the new versioning feature in SAP Analytics Cloud. I noticed that for a story which I have modified and saved multiple times, the File Versions dialog still only shows the “Current Version”.

No version history is being created, even though the story has been updated several times.

Does anyone know why SAC is not displaying additional versions in this case?

Thank you!

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud: How can I compare variable values?
entry.content:
Hello all,

in SAC I use BW live connection within a story. To read the value of a variable 0S_CUS I use:

var cust = Chart_59.getDataSource().getVariableValues("0S_CUS")[0];

 Then I try to compare the value of variable "cust". Why: I would like to hide some pages in my SAC story if the customer number is greater than 10000000. The infoobject for variable 0S_CUS is 0CUSTOMER (data type: CHAR, length 10).

But this is not working:

var border = "0010000000";
if (cust > border) {
Application.setPageVisible("Page_7", false);
} else {
Application.setPageVisible("Page_7", true);
}

The variable 0S_CUS is a select-option but we pre-fill it with only one value. 

The error is: auto-type conversion isn't supported.

Thanks for your help!

entry.title: SAP Business Data Cloud landscape (Q/Prod)
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
 
I have a question about the BDC landscape. Do you typically run separate BDC instances for Q and PROD (BDC‑Q and BDC‑PROD), or is there a single BDC where Datasphere (DSP) and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) each have Q and PROD tenants?
 
Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Scripting SAC with DropDown
entry.content:
Hi team,

I’m facing an issue while creating a form in SAP Analytics Cloud and I’d appreciate your help.

I have a table and a form.
When I select a row in the table and click a button, I retrieve the selected member and populate several input fields and a dropdown based on the member’s properties.

The InputFields are filled correctly, but the Dropdown isn't.
The value returned from the member property is not assigned to the dropdown, even though it is not empty.

In the final screenshot, I’ve added a visual explanation of the issue to make it clearer.

Snipped 1 – Populating the dropdown

Snipped 2 – Selecting a row in the table, clicking the button, and opening a popup that displays the data from the selected row

Here is the code I’m using:

 

Snipped 1:

Dropdown_31.removeAllItems(); // limpar o dropdown
 
var l_arr11= ArrayUtils.create(Type.string); // array de valores únicos
var allMembers5_$ = PlanningModel_1.getMembers("CP_DI_Projeto_PD", { limit: 1000 });
 
for (var a = 0; a < allMembers5_$.length; a++) {
    var tipo_projeto =allMembers5_$[a].properties["Tipo_Projeto"];
 
     var id20 = allMembers5_$[a].id;
    if (id20.startsWith("Dummy")) {
        continue;
    }
    // Verifica se o valor existe e ainda não foi adicionado
    if (tipo_projeto !== undefined && l_arr11.indexOf(tipo_projeto) === -1) {
console.log(tipo_projeto);
        l_arr11.push(tipo_projeto);
        Dropdown_31.addItem(tipo_projeto);
    }
}

Snipped 2:

 

var selections = Table_4.getSelections();
 
if (selections.length === 0) {
    return;
}
 
var sel = selections[0];
 
var selMeasure = sel[Alias.MeasureDimension];
 
if (selMeasure === undefined) {
 
    var dim = Table_4.getDimensionsOnRows()[0];
    var ds = Table_4.getDataSource();
 
    var member1 = ds.getResultMember(dim, sel);
console.log(member1);
 
    if (member1) {
        var descricao = member1.description;
        var tipoProjeto = member1.properties["CP_DI_Projeto_PD.Tipo_Projeto"];
var Datainicio = member1.properties["CP_DI_Projeto_PD.DataInicio"];
var DataFim = member1.properties["CP_DI_Projeto_PD.DataFim"];
 
        console.log(descricao);
        console.log(tipoProjeto);
 
 
        InputField_23.setValue(descricao);
InputField_25.setValue(Datainicio);
InputField_24.setValue(DataFim);
        Dropdown_29.setSelectedKey(tipoProjeto);
 
    }
}


 


Thank you,

Ganjos

entry.title: How to configure Cloud ALM to monitor Datasphere or SAC Connections?
entry.content:

Can this be done? If so, how can it be? I have not found this info anywhere on SAP websites.

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud Custom widget not working properly after making the changes
entry.content:
Hi Team,

Could someone please help me troubleshoot the error shown below?

I created a custom widget that displays a test message. Initially, the widget works correctly, but after making any changes to the code, I start encountering the error in View mode. Interestingly, the widget continues to work without any issues in Edit mode.

I have attached the console error details for reference.

Troubleshooting steps performed so far

  1. Updated the ID, tag, and description in the JSON file.
  2. Re‑uploaded the updated JSON and the zipped JS file.
  3. Cleared browser cache and refreshed the environment (if applicable).

Despite these actions, the issue still persists.

Also attached the json and js.

Requesting your help in identifying the root cause and resolving this issue.

@N1kh1l , @marouferchichi 

Thanks,

entry.title: Running Total is not visible in S/4 HANA CDS VIew Live Connection
entry.content:
Dear Community,

I am facing an issue with a chart in an SAC Optimized Story.
The backend source is S/4HANA with a live connection.

My requirement is to display the cumulative (running total) stock quantity by month. Based on my understanding, this should be achievable using the Running Total calculation. However, I am unable to find the Running Total option in the chart calculations.

Has anyone encountered a similar limitation with live connections or Optimized Stories?
Any guidance on how to achieve a cumulative stock quantity by month either through a workaround or backend logic would be highly appreciated.

Looking forward to your suggestions.

Thank you in advance.

To simplify the scenario, let’s start with the most basic model structure (see the image below).

The Number Dimension has following Masterdata:

Now, how can we set up a scenario where the next dataset is added based on the latest available Position Number?

For example:

  • If 1 already exists, then assign 2.

Does anyone have an idea how this could be implemented?

Kind regards

Ismail

entry.title: Email verification for provisioned users - IAS
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am provisioning users from a custom IdP (SCIM system) to IAS via IPS.

After users are provisioned and created in IAS, their email status is "Not Verified" in IAS. No verification email is being sent out to these provisioned users.

My questions:

  1. How can I ensure that users are automatically marked as "Verified" in IAS during the provisioning process?
  2. Alternatively: How can I trigger the verification email to be sent to these provisioned users during the provisioning process?

Thanks for your tips !

 

Best Regards

entry.title: SAC - set Dimension Filter on Account Dimension
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I'm fairly new to SAP Analytics Cloud and this is my first post here.

I am working in an Analytic Application and have a table where the Account dimension is used.
The table initially shows a few accounts correctly.

I want to create buttons so that the user can dynamically change which accounts are displayed in the table.

My script looks like this:

var ds = Table_7.getDataSource();

ds.setHierarchy("Account", "parentId");

ds.setDimensionFilter("Account", ["P&L_S1","P&L_S27","P&L_R5"]);

When I click the button, the table becomes empty (no error message).

The accounts exist in the model. At first, I thought it was a problem because these are parent nodes in the hierarchy, but nothing is displayed even for simple members.

Am I missing something regarding hierarchy handling or valid member IDs when using setHierarchy() together with setDimensionFilter()?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: SAC Planning: Keep value unchanged when writing from higher to lower granularity
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I’m working with a planning-enabled model in SAP Analytics Cloud. On top of this model I built a Story with two tables. Both tables are based on the same model.

Setup

  • Table A contains the measure “Konditionswert (PLAN) Vorbelegung” (pre-fill / default value).

  • Table B contains the measure “Konditionswert (PLAN)” (plan value).

Both tables use the following dimensions in the rows:

  1. Account system owner (Kontosysteminhaber)

  2. Account system product (Kontosystemprodukt)

  3. Account system ID (Kontosystem-ID)

  4. Product (Produkt)

Table B additionally includes the dimension “Account (IBAN)”.
So Table A shows data on account-system-ID level, while Table B is more detailed on account (IBAN) level.

A single account system can have multiple accounts assigned to it, and each account belongs to exactly one account system.

What I’m trying to achieve

I want users to plan values in the “Pre-fill” measure. For example, they enter 12 in Table A.
I created a Data Action that copies values from “Pre-fill” into “Plan” when executed.

My goal is:
When a user enters a value in Pre-fill, the exact same value should be written into Plan (without changing it).

The problem

Because Table A is at account-system level and Table B is at account level, when I run the Data Action the value is automatically distributed evenly across the accounts.

Example:
If I enter 12 for account system ID 12345, which has 2 accounts, then SAC writes 6 into Plan for each account instead of writing 12.

What I need

I want to allow a pre-fill on account-system level that is then applied to the individual accounts, so users don’t have to plan each account manually.

What do I need to do so that when posting a number in Table A (account-system level), the number is written to Table B (account level) without being split, i.e. the value should be copied as-is?

Thanks a lot for any help!

Best regards,
Niklas

entry.title: SAC – Dynamic Promotion Period Analysis Using a Single Date Dimension
entry.content:
Hello everyone,
In SAP Analytics Cloud (Import Model), my sales data contains only one time dimension (Created On).

For promotion analysis, I need to compare sales before, during, and after a selected promotion. These periods are not fixed and must be dynamically derived from the promotion’s start and end dates. All periods should remain aligned to the selected promotion and be evaluated simultaneously.

I’m trying to understand whether SAP Analytics Cloud supports this type of analysis using dynamic date filters or restricted measures on a single date dimension, or if this is a known limitation.

I’m open to alternative or recommended approaches in SAC, such as:

  • using advanced formulas instead of restricted measures

  • introducing helper dimensions or flags

  • separating promotion metadata into a dedicated model

  • or restructuring the story/model if needed

Any best-practice guidance or design recommendations would be greatly appreciated.

Example;

Date dimension is CreatedOn
Measure is Quantity

During promotion range is 10.03.2025 to 15.04.2025
Before promotion range with a 50 day lookback is 19.01.2025 to 09.03.2025
After promotion range with a 50 day look forward is 19.04.2025 to 04.06.2025

To analyze this, I created three separate restricted measures for each date range. This works, but the setup is not dynamic.

I can change the during promotion range by adjusting the fixed date filter, but then I also have to manually recalculate and update the before and after ranges. Ideally, I would like to change only the promotion period and have the before and after periods update automatically based on the same lookback and look forward logic.
